author: ayaxlabombarda
title: Innovatio Cross-Chain ADA-AVAX-DOT
description: The technism of Cardano smart contracts, with Haskell/Plutus, doesn't attract most developers and entrepreneurs under Solidity standards, making adoption and cross-chain collaborations more difficult.

f6_assessments.q0: I agree with proposers that Solidity attracts  most developers and entrepreneurs comparing to Haskell/Plutus tech which is behind Cardano. That’s why educating and informing entrepreneurs, developers about Cardano looks as a good idea, but that’s also very simple and basic idea. There are really a lot of educational proposals in many categories, After reading proposal carefully I still have many question of how Polkadot and Avalanche blockchain communities will become interested in Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience of the team is good, what’s more interesting that Innovatio as a brand was born thanks to Project Catalyst funds in Fund 3. Since then Innovatio have 5 funded proposals, and all the relevant links are present in this new proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability section is ok, but I think you could put more details on the budget breakdown. By the way, the budget of $53 600 seems to be big as for educational proposal focusing only on 2 blockchains. In case this proposal doesn’t win this time, I would advise you to put more metrics and more KPIs.

f6_assessments.q0: Great to find this type of idea. The proposal gets along with the challenge. The way it's presented gives a clear view that these 3 different blockchains could work together (ADA-AVAX-POLK) and learn, expand and promote cross-chain collaborations. Education as a strong point as described, with a variety of supporting material (from the basics to the advanced). The community leader's role will be more than important to fulfill the idea, providing complete information about the current situation regarding other projects and communities of AVAX and POLKADOT chains.
f6_assessments.q1:
Innovatio has an active community that has grown in Catalyst, with more than 1 year of operations and more than 8 months with communities.  They could complete the task while repeating what they have actually done. The team is complete, well organized, and presented with competitive skills. There’s a PDF file attached with their LinkedIn (this means, the team is already hired and working). The social networks are updated, spread a variety of content (blockchain-related) and they are verbose at marketing image. 

The plan is well described, with clear objectives and time frames. In addition, the plan is divided into different phases making an easy-to-follow checkpoint.  No doubt that they understand what they are challenging. The opportunity’s on the game and they want to take it by selecting two important blockchains that are growing in a healthy way as Cardano is. The budget is more than acceptable due to requires a lot of material production and work hours.
f6_assessments.q2: As they have previous experience creating communities, making growth, and connecting people, they learned how to do it. In this case, KPIs are very clear and understandable. Easy to measure progress and continue the evolution of impact. The tools that they are going to use like Tribe.so, are ideal in this case so they can manage and do internal checkpoints. The people outside this project could follow the evolution vía their social networks. This means that it is very easy to audit by anyone.

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge by exploring, participating in, and documenting potential linkages between other blockchains (Polkadot and Avalanche) and Cardano. The team will enter into the two different ecosystems and identify ways to build bridges across them. This is exactly in line with the challenge and is an excellent approach. 

A strong selling feature of this approach is that it focuses on what brings us together as chains, rather than what divides us. This is important given all the insanity that is in the crypto space. This approach would definitely go far to reduce the maximalism of the different chains and potentially inspire many different groups to work together. 

Another strong feature about this proposal is that it can be easily replicated. If successful, the team would be able to continue to explore a variety of chains at once, or inspire their community to reach out on their own. This could further drive the impact and deliver real value for Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1:
Yes, given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. 

First off, Innovatio is already well established in the Cardano community and has received several rounds of funding. I really appreciated that not only did they link to the proposals that were funded, they also showed the percentages of how much was completed. The workload appears completely reasonable to add on to their existing projects. 

Second, Mauro and Juan Pablo are active community members and participate many different fora to share their thoughts, which are insightful and provide a unique perspective. It is certain that should they be funded again that they will continue to lead their larger teams to success. 

Lastly, the budget appears to be off in that they decided to increase the community leader's labour and content redaction for four months but have them listed at three months. At first this threw me off and I was going to mark it down but it is likely a simple mistake. I'd maybe just encourage the proposers to do a final scrub by a couple different sets of eyes to catch these mistakes.
f6_assessments.q2:
Yes, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal. 

When reading this is obvious that the innovatio team has been through this process before, however, I wish the success measures were a bit better communicated. While they do an excellent job of clearly articulating their KPIs in a measurable way (# of members, # of publications...) they don't set themselves any real thresholds to reach. To me this is a bit of a let down because it will be impossible for the community to know if the project succeeded and when. 

I appreciate the team wants to see the expansion of knowledge, projects, and synergies across these other blockchain communities and Cardano, but what does success look like? While they envision multiple members of the aforementioned blockchains exchanging knowledge, thoughts, views, philosophies, etc, what do the exchanges include? Is a conversation enough? Is 3 collabs enough? This type of information is necessary for auditing whether the project was a success or not. 

Overall excellent proposal and I look forward to the results, however, just shy of 5s across the board due to the lack of measurable success indicators.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is aligned with the challenge, its audiovisual, informative and educational content, as well as the work of its community leaders will provide valuable information such as scholarship programs, communities and important projects of each chain, giving us greater knowledge to promote cross-chain collaborations in the future.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan presented is well explained, concise and detailed, they currently have their social networks active, fulfilling a minimum post a day, the proposed plan has no major complexity, they want to change their approach to marketing, community and information level, developing audiovisual content more in line to know the ecosystems of Cardano, Avalanche and Polkadot, bringing more information about them and encouraging collaborations and cross-chains interactions with their Tribe.so and Discord platform, which provide a public space to interact and consume this information. In addition, Innovatio has a team with more than 1 year of experience in Catalyst, a growing community, social networks with content production, so I do not see great risks in the successful development of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided I believe is sufficient to measure the progress, impact and efficiency of the proposal, from the financing of the proposal, to the completion of the 4 month plan presented.

These metrics allow us to know both the impact of the content in social networks, as well as the impact of the Tribe.so platform, this is important because the success of the proposal depends on a good work together.

f6_assessments.q0: Innovatio's proposal is very successful at this time of the bear market. It is the time when bridges and alliances must be built with communities that have similar technology and interest in Cardano. The Polkadot and Avalanche networks comply. Facing the challenge from the community side will take a softer, friendlier approach. The budget is in accordance with what the challenge presents as total availability. Lastly, and from what I was seeing, Innovatio has a very good audiovisual production quality for social networks and community portals. Therefore, they will be comfortable with the execution of the proposal in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: It is very interesting how Innovatio presents the workflow for the development of the proposal. They have experience having been financed in previous Catalyst funds, so I have no doubt that they will be able to achieve the proposed goals and objectives as a team. Above all, they already have their own community developed and participate in spaces of other communities, therefore they will be able to make a friendly approach with Solidity developers who are migrating from Ethereum. The plan is feasible to carry out and within achievable times.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal contains metrics that serve to measure the impact on communities and social networks with the involvement of their leaders. Show a clear vision of success in order to achieve the goals of the challenge. Additionally, as they are open communities that Innovatio will deal with, anyone outside the proposal can audit the progress simply by interacting.

f6_assessments.q0: I determined that the proposal addresses the goal set out in the Challenge, which is "Cross-chain Collaboration". Solidity developers and entrepreneurs are not attracted to Cardano smart contract technology. That was the problem the team identified that needed to be solved. And they have a specific solution that is to inform, and even train entrepreneurs and developers to know more about Cardano, I'm sure this adds value to the Cardano ecosystem and can scale to address future challenges. More than that, it benefits many other blockchains as well (as long as that blockchain is capable of partnering with the Cardano blockchain). The essence of the proposal is to seek to promote cooperation and interoperability among the major blockchains in the ecosystem. I understand the team is trying to link people who use programming languages ​​other than Haskell/Plutus who know Cardano, who knows Haskell/Plutus. I can see this proposal as a bridge between the "Solidity" team and the "Haskell" team, bringing people who didn't know Cardano before to now to know about Cardano. That is a prerequisite for cross-chain cooperation. Therefore, I appreciate the impact of this proposal. I am very interested in this proposal because of the possibilities it can bring. I vote 5 stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
Regarding the detailed budget breakdown, the budget listed by the team consists of different items that are relevant to the goal but appear to be poorly presented. On what basis can the team explain on what basis the team claims that the cost of items is that much? Team members are all experienced people working with Catalyst from Fund 3, who know programming languages, and blockchain. This is quite favorable for the team's credibility and the feasibility of the proposal. I did open the file the team cited to see more of the team members' identities, but when I opened it I saw nothing but three lines of text (not in English). Hopefully, the team will review to see if there is any confusion here or not? This leaves me a little disappointed in the transparency and feasibility of the proposal. I would like to ask further that in addition to waiting for funding from the Catalyst Fund, is the team funded from other sources of organizations? If Catalyst has not yet been funded in Fund 9, will the team continue to implement the proposal? I ask this question because I want to further verify the feasibility of the proposal through the budget.
About the plan and how to do it: Relatively clear in a certain order. This is understandable because the team is a collection of people who have experience in organizing the implementation and especially when the proposed implementation has been approved in Fund 6 and several other times.
In terms of resources needed for implementation, I temporarily divided it into two main resources, which are financial resources (mentioned in the above budget) and necessary human resources for implementation. offer. With the current people, I believe the feasibility of the proposal will be successfully implemented. However, there is a detail shared by the team that some members are also working on another proposal parallel to this proposal at Fund 9. I would like to ask if this affects the quality of work in this proposal. Is it reduced due to scattered human resources? According to my contribution, the team was able to further demonstrate to the community that even though members are implementing another proposal, human resources are still 100% guaranteed for the successful implementation of this proposal. It is a great way to create more trust in the community and increase the feasibility of the proposal.
In terms of technical aspects applied in the proposal. I understand that introducing Haskell to the Solidity community is not an easy job. It requires a high level of technical knowledge, even knowing both Solidity and Haskell programming languages. I can trust this in the team because the team has members with full technical knowledge, even though they know both programming languages ​​like I just mentioned. In addition to other skills related to communication and training, I believe that the team will do very well when implementing the technical and technological aspects of the proposed implementation.
The team correctly stated that the risk factor here is that the cryptocurrency market is going down, leading to a decrease in the community's interest in the cryptocurrency and blockchain market. The team made a strong effort to identify solutions to address the risk challenge. I would like to comment on another possible risk which is Ada slippage, this is what some teams have encountered in Fund 7 and Fund 8 when Ada lost value compared to before. resulting in a decrease in the project funding budget. Therefore, I advise the team to carefully consider the problem of Ada's price slippage to have the requirements and balance the budget accordingly, to avoid a budget shortage that makes it difficult to make suggestions. If the team needs more funding, come up with a verifiable plan.
Just now are my opinions on the feasibility of the proposal, hope the team will consider and consider my questions and comments as a positive contribution to the proposal to be more and more perfect. . I agree with the feasibility, but advise the team to seriously review the issues I have raised. I vote 4 stars.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree with the way the team presents the roadmap and the milestones (the team has attached specific months of the year to the goals to be accomplished). That is the milestone, the roadmap that every community wants to evaluate because it is convenient for them to evaluate and verify. I see not many proposals to do this, thereby demonstrating the thoroughness of the team's roadmap. This has made it easy for the community to determine the transparency and auditability of the proposal. The professionalism of the team is also reflected in the very orderly work order. The proposal is well written and organized, has clear intentions, and good methodology.
It's a pity that I didn't see the KPI, we all know KPI plays an important role in the audit. I advise the team to add KPIs as soon as possible to improve transparency and auditability. In return, key metrics have been stated with the following criteria: Number of members, number of publications, number of participants, etc... The team can further perfect key metrics when attaching numbers to it. specific - to me, it's great to conduct an audit.
The team defined proposal success as expanding reach, expanding knowledge of projects, building bridges, etc... I agree with that definition of success.
The problems in the whole proposal were clearly and easily described by the team, along with the appropriate solution. I agree with the auditability of the proposal. I vote 4 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The technology of Cardano smart contracts, with Haskell/Plutus, is unattractive to most developers and entrepreneurs who adhere to Solidity standards, making cross-chain adoption and collaboration more difficult. The author proposed a solution to Engage, educate and inform entrepreneurs and developers about Cardano, facilitate ecosystem adoption, and foster collaboration with other chains . The proposed impact on the challenge has been outlined and described in great detail. Innovatio is a community of: entrepreneurs, developers in Catalyst Fund 3 and received the first funding in Fund 6, has become a community brand, within the ecosystem, helping many members achieve Target in the Discord community with over 500 members, verified. Innovatio wants to expand the community to other major Blockchains in the ecosystem. Help members of the community, Catalyst and other Blockchains, to connect, collaborate and start-ups, for multi-chain development and partnerships. Besides, the author also realizes that the main risk in the project is: a market, falling in price, with the risk of people unfollowing the news, about the crypto world. Along with that risk, the author has come up with a solution to reduce the risk by; will adopt the strategy of quickly digging every virtual space and community to make Innovatio public.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the plan of the proposal, the author provides us with background information to evaluate this section. The first is about the route. The proponent cites the goals to be achieved in 5 months (Starting from September 2022 until January). At the same time, the author also provides information about the work to be done in each month. Next is the budget. Proposal asks for $53,600. In my opinion, the requested value is quite reasonable for the duration of the project. The author has provided a very detailed budget table. The budgets are broken down, and allocated to each very specific job, estimated with the monthly job. Finally, about the team of team members. We checked information about Innovatio startup team members. As we know, the team has many members: Alvaro Quiroga Toledo - CTO Development Team; Agustin Jordi Rojas - Full Stack Developer, John Paul Barea - Community Leader and Ambassador... Also we got to know more about each member's biographies, interests, and crypto knowledge . We know about each member's years and experience, suitable to carry out the work in the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The author provides us with metrics so that we can easily track successful progress in a project. We can track in many ways, the phases of the project will develop. The number of members in each space is equal to Tribe.so. The number of successful multimodal partnerships achieved by: Tribe Innovatio Community Space... by the information the author has provided, we believe that sufficient, and satisfactory information has been established. We know the value it will bring to the community and the ecosystem. And the final product is what is expected, the success of this project. Promote networking between entrepreneurs, developers and projects; Benefits between Cardano, Avalanche and Polkadot blockchains, building bridges. Auditable Proposals are completely transparent. The proposal has a plan for clear implementation. Budgets are broken down for easy audit. The members have enough experience and professional skills, increasing the sustainable strength for the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I feel like this proposal is highly comprehensive of all the factors and aspects involved in the onboarding process from other chains to Cardano, both in the technical and business domains.
In that regard, the proposal does an accurate job at describing common pain points from entrepreneurs and crypto builders, and aims to establish open community spaces where developers can discuss and share their experiences. To me, this would be an essential activity to incentivize collaboration, networking, and mutual learning between Cardano, Avalanche, and Polkadot builders, which is this challenges main focus. As a result, I deem this proposal highly impactful.
f6_assessments.q1: The budget specified is highly detailed and accurate, although a bit high. Additionally, the schedule presented on a month-by-month basis seems feasible. The author also presents additional documents that explain how the team will handle responsibilities and past successes from the Innovatio organization. All information provided by the proposal are, in my opinion, enough proof that the team is more than capable of implementing this proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The information offers clear and accurate metrics that will effectively measure the results considering the challenge's goals. However, I grant only four stars as it lacks specific data-collection methods (surveys, forms, email) and platforms used to present this results in an open, public manner. Additionally, for a proposal such as this, I'd also like to see a qualitative analysis, determining developer experience in-depth to see exactly what value they extracted from the Innovatio Spaces.

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree that the answer covers all the criteria, due to the fact that the proposal remarks what members come through with when choosing a Blockchain to start developing entrepreneurships, taking into account the high technical level our Cardano Blockchain has, that might give doubts to the future members. The solution this proposal gives is the exact tool that will improve the synergism between freelancers to collaborate with each other and also, incentivizes the interoperability between different Blockchains.
f6_assessments.q1: Innovatio has been working and submitting proposals since Fund 3, that is why I do believe it has all needed experience gained since all this time as well as a complete experienced team, this combination may develop successfully the proposal. And according to the plan I believe it would be great to include  community leaders and marketing specialists from the other Blockchains, in order to increase the knowledge about the interoperability the project wants as an objective.  However, it does not justify the amount of funding this proposal is asking for the impact it might have in Cardano in case it is successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal gives an according information to audit the progress of it.
However I would recommend to be more clear when explaining how the team is going to work and specifically what type of strategies will adopt when going through a bear market, for examples in what virtual events the team is going to assist, and what other marketing and branding strategies will implement to attract people  though this hypothetical situation in the market.

f6_assessments.q0: A compelling approach to attract more developers to expand the number of adaptations on Cardano. The problem is well-addressed and the solution is indicated in an understandable way. However, the team should give links to their website or discord group for better insights of the community they have built and the content they have generated. Furthermore, they should specify clearly the reason why they move to Tribe.so - a quite expensive alternative rather than Discord - a much cheaper option. In general, more explanation is needed but this team has received fund from Catalyst before so this really add up to their reliablity.
f6_assessments.q1:
Their plan is quite detailed with the intended work for each month from September to January but if possible, could the team provide more information of how they conduct these works? It can be their suggestion of the activities, the amount of content they plan to produce, etc. Also, they can give some examples of their previous content generated for the community to have a better view on their work. Regarding the budget breakdown, it is simple yet clear and reasonable.

The team’s members give us a very detailed description of each person with biography, crypto knowledge and hobbies  in well-designed slides. This way, we get to know each member more as a person but it doesn't make the proposal become too lengthy. Plus, the slides also give descriptions of Innovation' partners, advisors and members of each partner. I compliment the team for organizing information this way to keep the proposal brief. The members' background education and experience all match with their roles. They are a complete team with engineers, marketers, content writers, legal advisors, etc. I have no doubt in the team's ability to conduct their plan.
f6_assessments.q2: They do provide metrics to help us track the project’s progress easier. The metrics are distinct and reasonable. Nonetheless, their vision of this project success is still vague. In this part, it is recommend that they give the estimated result of this project based on the key metrics to decide it is successful.

solution: Attract, educate and inform entrepreneurs and developers about Cardano, facilitating the adoption of its ecosystem and fostering collaborations with other chains by betting on interoperability.
experience: Innovatio is a brand composed of a team of 9 people and an external branding agency, has a team specialized in various fields, they were born thanks to Catalyst funds in March 2021, Fund 3. Currently Innovatio have 5 funded proposals (check bios PDFs).
